content: The Act may be cited as the "Agricultural Energy Programs Reauthorization Act of 2017". The Act includes a section on the Biobased Markets Program. Section 9002 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include renewable chemicals in the definition of biobased products. The Secretary is also directed to focus on education and outreach in this regard. The Secretary, in consultation with the Administrator, will provide education and outreach to stakeholders regarding the voluntary labeling program for renewable chemicals and biobased products. The Secretary and the Secretary of Commerce will develop NAICS codes for renewable chemicals manufacturers. The Secretary will establish a national testing center registry and require a description of the quantity of biobased products procured in the previous year. The Secretary will establish a national testing center registry and require a description of the quantity of biobased products procured in the previous year. Amendments include increasing funding to $6,000,000 for fiscal years 2019 through 2023 and expanding the definition of products to include those produced from biologically captured and reused carbon. The bill includes provisions for biorefinery, renewable chemical, and biobased product manufacturing assistance. Section 9003 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include provisions for biorefinery, renewable chemical, and biobased product manufacturing assistance. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to allocate $75,000,000 annually for loan guarantees for fiscal years 2019 through 2023 from the Commodity Credit Corporation funds. SEC. 4 amends the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 to allocate $5,000,000 annually for advanced biofuels program for fiscal years 2018 through 2023. SEC. 5 pertains to the Rural Energy for America Program. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to define a renewable energy system as one that produces usable energy from a renewable source, including distribution components. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to allocate $150,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2018 to 2023 for renewable energy system components and infrastructure. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to allocate $150,000,000 annually from 2018 to 2023 for renewable energy system components and infrastructure. Additionally, not more than 30 percent of the funding can be used for specific renewable energy technologies or energy efficiency improvements. SEC. 6 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to allocate $20,000,000 annually for biomass research and development from 2019 to 2023. SEC. 7 establishes a feedstock flexibility program for bioenergy producers. SEC. 7 amends the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 to extend the feedstock flexibility program for bioenergy producers until 2023. In paragraph (2), the Secretary shall use not less than $50,000,000 for transportation payments for hazardous woody fuel reduction projects under subsection (d)(3) and not less than 10 percent, and not greater than 50 percent, of the remaining amount. The Community Wood Energy Program under the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is extended until 2023. The amendments made by this Act will be effective on October 1, 2018.
